text: hey all, I'm sick today, will be WFH, planning to be online all day
^^^ Same here. I'll be online.
Oh no! Hope you both feel better quickly.
We got a very last minute invite to watch focus group testing the All Day social concepts <https://livestream.com/accounts/5314594/events/6708871>
A session is in progress now, that started at 4, and there are additional sessions at 5:30 and 7:00
I'm not a big focus group fan, but it's pretty interesting. This group is not into the social concept. It'll be interesting to see if this is across the board.
whoa very cool thanks for sharing
Super curious to hear what the social concept is and why they aren't in to it
partially it might have been a screening issue, and focus groups can skew things. they thought that the idea of having or being a "motivator" was creepy
there was a woman who is primary a climber who felt like this would be good for "gym rats who like to brag on social media"
the two men felt like their activity was private, and they would like to keep it that way
they said they couldn't handle one more feed in their lives
and that it's one thing to cheer on someone losing 200 pounds to save their lives, but they're not interested in someone's regular run 5 days a week
there was one participant that thought her friends would like it, but she is sick of seeing their health updates all the time
the thing I hate about a focus group is that you can't tell if they were influencing each other, and if they would have felt differently if they experienced it in a different setting

I missed the intro, but there were 5 people, one was primarily a sedentary deer hunter, one was a rock climber, one runs but it's not his identity, one woman aspires to be healthier, and the other one didn't talk except to say that she doesn't like competitive activities
second group is filing in now

I feel like I’ve heard “I wouldn’t share anything but I have friends that might” more times than I can count… yet so few people saying they would share their activity themselves. I find that really interesting how often it comes up.
It's a thing that you see in user research quite a bit. It's like saying "it's not you, it's me"
Hmm, good insight
wow super interesting thx for sharing megan!
